title: France sees diffuse fears mount about a war that has not yet arrived
summary: The speed with which the world order has been turned upside down has caused anxiety in France, adding to worries stemming from the country's domestic political instability.

title: Bernie Sanders on tour in Denver: 'We will not allow America to become an oligarchy'
summary: The Vermont senator and leader of the progressive left wants to build a movement beyond the Democratic Party to encourage citizens to defend democracy.

title: Michael Lind: 'Trump represents a nationalist tradition that goes back to Nixon'
summary: Despite his inconsistencies, the American president has always criticized free trade and the American military umbrella. For four decades, he has described the United States' allies as parasites, highlights the Texan writer and academic.

title: Turkey: Istanbul court orders detention of Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu, amid mass protests
summary:
Charged with 'corruption' and 'aiding a terror organization,' the arrest 
of Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu, seen as the main opposition figure against President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, triggered nationwide protests.

title: Remembering George Foreman, the pastor who boxed 'without hatred'
summary: Two-time heavyweight champion of the world, the American, who died on Friday, was 76 years old. Having become a pastor after a bad defeat, he took part in the mythical fight against Mohamed Ali in 1974, before making an unexpected comeback in the 1990s.

title: France and Spain win on penalties to reach Nations League semi-finals
summary: Spain and France edged past the Netherlands and Croatia in dramatic penalty shoot-outs, while Portugal battled past Denmark in extra time and Germany survived an Italy comeback to secure their spots in the Nations League semi-finals. The last four will see Spain take on France and Portugal face Finals hosts Germany in June.

title: Israel's ground offensive pushes deeper into Gaza
summary: A few days after re-starting hostilities in Gaza, the Israeli army has encircled Rafah city. Meanwhile, the Israeli Defense Minister spoke about annexing territory in Gaza, an idea that was met with international outcry.

title: The execution of four Canadians in China is a reminder of Beijing's stringent anti-drug laws
summary: The country is extremely tough on drug-related crime. A Frenchman, convicted in 2010 by a Canton court, is still on death row.

title: Journalists in Russia: 'It's much more dangerous today than it was under perestroika'
summary: Russian media outlets operating from abroad are discreetly giving remote training to young people in Russia. It's a risky task in a country that ranks 162nd for press freedom worldwide.

title: Pope Francis waved to the faithful in his first appearance since being hospitalized
summary: Shortly before going back to his residence for convalescence, Pope Francis, 88, waved and said a few words, notably calling for a 'definitive ceasefire' in Gaza, in his first public appearance since his five-week hospitalization.

title: Kirsty Coventry, the International Olympic Committee's new president, faces challenges
summary: Kirsty Coventry will officially succeed Thomas Bach on June 23, but urgent issues, such as the return of Russian athletes and relations with Donald Trump, will be on her agenda during the institution's transition period.

title: Canadian PM Mark Carney calls snap elections for April 28
summary: Canada, under increasing threat from US President Donald's Trump's trade war and expansionist rhetoric, will hold snap elections on April 28, announced new Prime Minister Mark Carney

title: Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei is the main obstacle to negotiations with the US
summary: With the considerable risk of war with Israel and a worsening economy, the government temporarily eases its grip on civil society.

title: Virginie Adane, historian: 'Trump believes the US is the greatest country and should be celebrated without nuance'
summary: In two books about the origins of the United States and the place of women in the American narrative, Adane sheds light on the issues at stake in the cultural battle underway across the Atlantic.

title: The Eiffel Tower sex toy: A story of monumental pleasure
summary: This patriotic French-made dildo, designed by visual artist Sébastien Lecca in 2012, has been a huge success and continues to thrill people around the world.

title: 'Space has become a potential battlefield, and we need to be ready for it'
summary: In an interview with 'Le Monde,' CNES CEO Lionel Suchet explains that space collaboration between the US and Europe could be called into question as US President Trump has SpaceX CEO Elon Musk at his side.

title: US-Ukraine truce talks are due to start on Sunday, while Kremlin downplays expectations
summary: US officials in Saudi Arabia are set to hold two rounds of talks, first with Ukraine, on Sunday, and then with Russia. While the US envoy has been optimistic, the Kremlin's Dmitry Peskov warned of 'difficult negotiations.'

title: 'In the face of the US president's astonishing shift, Europe suddenly appears as a familiar and reassuring presence'
summary: In her column, the sociologist writes that Europeans seem to be waking up to everything that unites them. But a war economy will only be acceptable if it comes with the promise of greater social well-being for citizens.

title: Jailed Istanbul mayor Imamoglu vows to fight as protests rock Turkey
summary: Tens of thousands rallied outside City Hall, denouncing what they call a politically motivated crackdown. Despite government efforts to suppress dissent, opposition leaders say the backlash has ignited a 'great awakening.'

title: US and Ukraine hold 'productive' talks in Saudi Arabia ahead of ceasefire negotiations
summary: US and Ukrainian officials concluded 'productive and focused' talks in Saudi Arabia on Sunday over efforts to de-escalate the war with Russia, as Moscow prepared for its own separate discussions with American negotiators.

title: South Korea's top court reinstates PM Han as acting president
summary: South Korea’s Constitutional Court dismissed the impeachment of Prime Minister Han Duck-soo on Monday, reinstating him as acting president. The ruling comes as the court deliberates on the fate of suspended President Yoon Suk Yeol, whose attempted martial law declaration in December set off a constitutional showdown.

title: Istanbul Mayor Imamoglu, Erdogan’s main rival, calls his imprisonment 'a coup'
summary: Protests are growing against the conviction of Ekrem Imamoglu and the arrest of his security detail. On Sunday, the city and the country woke up in shock. Hundreds of students have been arrested.

title: The United Arab Emirates' triple game in Gaza
summary: While developing their strategic partnership with Israel, the United Arab Emirates are claiming to rally to the Arab consensus on a Palestinian state, and are careful to stage their humanitarian aid in the Gaza Strip, historian Jean-Pierre Filiu notes in his column.

title: Enrico Letta: 'France is paying for a big mistake, the switch from a seven- to a five-year presidential term'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the former Italian prime minister analyzes the situation in France. For Letta, the political crisis in France is merely an epiphenomenon of a country suffering from a kind of déclassement.
